The bathroom was pristine, the shower was lovely, and there were plenty of towels. There is a Safeway close by in case you need to get groceries, and it's just a short (20 minute) drive to Napa. The Michael Warring restaurant is also a ten minute drive away and highly recommended! We would certainly stay with Susan again if we are ever in the area!

My daughter and I stayed for 7 days at Susan and Tom's cozy cottage. It exceeded our expectations. We really appreciated the goodies left for us in the kitchen along with a bottle of wine. We felt very "at home" and highly recommend for other prospective travelers.

We enjoyed staying at Susan's place. It was very comfortable and homey, and we appreciated the snacks left for us. The location is convenient and a good value if you are visiting Napa. Susan was very responsive whenever we had a question, thank you!
Excellent place to stay

Enjoyed Susan's place. Very peaceful, beautiful yard and quiet. Loved the added bonus... complimentary bottle of wine and light breakfast items.
The T.V. didn't work the whole time we were there which really didn't matter a lot to us. We were out and about the majority of the time.

We enjoyed the stay and the great gardens. Good location for the price. We will recommend this cottage to friends,
thanks again. Todd

Nice separate cottage space and kitchen had everything we needed to make meals there. Also nice they had a couple fans and left us a bottle of wine! Nice that they left us park in the driveway. The immediately surrounding neighborhood was nice but just down the road seemed a bit questionable but we just didn’t do much around the area so didn’t bother us. The direct neighborhood felt safe. We enjoyed our stay here.

Susan’s cottage was everything we expected and more. The cottage is kept in wonderful shape and is decorated very tastefully. It is just beautiful! Susan and Tom were very friendly and helpful during our stay. She also provided us with goodies when we checked in. They were very much appreciated! My family and I were very comfortable and felt safe there. We would definitely stay in the cottage again as it has all the comforts of home. Thank you Susan!

Susan‘s place was lovely! It was as described, clean, and Susan was very informative and accommodating. Aside from a small snafu with the entry code, which Susan more than made up for, it was a perfect stay! I would definitely recommend!

Susan was very responsive with great recommendations for local restaurants and things to do in the area. Her home was very cozy and clean. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens. Would definitely stay here again.
It was a great, clean, easy, and homey experience! I would definitely recommend it!

What a great cottage… We were greeted by a sweet and helpful host who otherwise left us to enjoy our visit to wine country in peace. The place is fully stocked for your stay. The best part are the fragrances blowing through the windows.

I enjoyed my stay at Susan‘s cottage. It was perfect for what I needed and in a central location. I was there for 8 days.
The neighborhood was quiet, and the cottage was very comfortable, quaint and private.
The kitchen had great basics which allowed me to cook some days. It was kind of Susan to have some treats available upon arrival: fresh cherries, English muffins, coffee. The upstairs loft area was cozy. It does get hot during the day; however, raising the windows and using a fan she left cooled down the space quickly.
The Wi-Fi was spotty so it was hard to work or watch TV. I had to use my hotspot. I did mention to Susan who had noticed and was very responsive.
My only issue was checking in. Me and my daughter arrived at 1:30 AM from the East Coast. We were both beyond tired and on a 3-hour time difference. I totally forgot the cottage entrance was further down the driveway and was using my code at the wrong door. A sign on the garage pointing to the cottage could help.
Very enjoyable and a great place to stay. Would stay here again.
We had a wonderful stay, thank you!
We had a great stay at Susan’s place! Very lovely and cute. Great location - 2 amazing sweets cats 🐈 🐈‍⬛ around the property and great communication!

Beautiful place to stay for a trip to Napa! Susan has a gorgeous cottage, she leaves you a bottle of wine, & she goes above & beyond by providing a list of recommendations to visit/ try in the Napa valley area! Not to mention she’s very quick with responding & is always available to help you out. 10/10 stay, would do it again!
Susan and Tom made is feel at home and went out for there way to accommodate use and assist us with any problems we may encountered! Great host!
Really enjoyed our stay. Close enough to Napa and Sonoma to go check out wineries around area.
Very nice stay, cozy chalet, very considerate and friendly host. Quiet neighborhood, as I expected. Would recommend
Quaint backyard cottage with all the amenities you could need for a short-term or long-term stay. Susan, was very responsive and helpful and I would definitely stay here again.
Great stay! The cottage was comfortable and had the basics needed for a two week stay. Susan was very responsive to help when we had any questions.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Susan’s for two weeks while traveling. Vallejo was in the perfect location for us between San Francisco and Napa! We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Susan’s! We had everything we needed and it such a cute cozy spot for us. The bed was extremely comfortable! Susan was an amazing host! She provided great recommendations for us and was always a quick call away if we needed anything. We would definitely come back to stay here😊 I can’t say enough good things about our stay!

Highly recommend Susan's place to anyone looking to stay in the Vallejo area. Safe, quiet neighborhood located near the freeway for easy access to all of the Bay Area. The Airbnb had everything I needed during my six week stay. Susan was very responsive to the minor issues I had. Would stay again.

The guest house was very nice and we appreciated being able to park on the driveway. The interior was cozy and had good energy. It was annoying that we had to buy our own toilet paper and paper towels because there was only a quarter roll for our 1 week stay. And the heater is so loud and clanky it takes over the whole room. Also, the TV is very small and needs to be updated, the buttons on the remote barely work even after changing the battery's. Also, there is not a lot of privacy downstairs because there are only sheer, see through window coverings. So when you get out of the shower everyone can see you. When you do anything everyone can potentially see you.
great stay, cozy house, great location, great host - very helpful
Very well put together, comfortable, had everything I needed for my stay, would recommend for anyone to stay here. beautiful and charming
Fantastic! Clean and comfortable! We loved our stay!

great stay! i didn’t read carefully and didn’t realize the house didn’t have AC so our first night was HOT. however when it cooled down, it was really nice with the windows open. would still recommend!
This place is very nice. Would highly recommend staying here.

A great place to stay. Beautiful place, close to Napa and with all the amenities that you need. Great communication: happy to help if you needed it but also happy to leave you to it if you prefer.
Very clean and comfortable. Would highly recommend.
Susan’s space was perfect and as described. She was very responsive as well. Highly recommend!!!

My wife and I had a great time in Vallejo at Susan's place. Alexander was a tremendous host setting everything up as we arrived. The location was great and central to everything we did - Sanoma Valley, Napa Valley, Bodega Bay, Sausalito and San Francisco. We will stay again should we return to the area. Thanks, Alexander, for everything and Tom, for all the local gems you provided in San Fran.
Very pleasant stay in Susan’s cottage
Very nice and welcoming place to stay. Pretty neighborhood. We enjoyed our stay very much.
Very nice cottage in a quiet neighborhood close to six flags park.
Great place! spacious and very clean. Appreciated the snacks and the kitchen with everything we could need.
Beautiful, clean, comfortable & welcoming! We loved our time at the cottage. Already looking forward to coming back one day!
Susan was a great host. Cottage was very cute and spacious. Would definitely stay here again!

Thank you so much for having us. It was the perfect location for us, split between Napa and Sausalito and had everything we needed to have a great stay. Our host provided us with a continental type breakfast, to get our vacation started. We loved how private, charming and comfortable, the guest house was. We will definitely book again when we come back to Napa.
Great hosts, location can’t be beat to do everything Northern California. Right in the middle.
Nice and clean. Quiet area. Communication from Susan was great. We would stay here again and would definitely recommend it to others.

Beautiful stay in Vallejo! The hosts were so kind from the moment I got there and throughout my entire stay. The house was beautifully furnished with a well-stocked kitchen. Very comfortable stay. The bedroom upstairs was very comfortable and cozy. Laundry was conveniently in the garage. Thank you, Susan and your family!

The cottage felt much more spacious than we were expecting! It was perfectly cozy, clean, and relaxing. It was the most ideal oasis after a long week. Susan and Tom left the best recommendations for dining, local activities, and even a new band! We are definitely looking forward to staying here again.

Susan was very responsive and helpful. She was eager to share her knowledge of the area. The check-in and check-out process was easy and worked around our crazy flight times without disruption. The cottage was so cute and perfect for my mom and I to stay. Susan's welcoming touch of snacks and a bottle of wine was so thoughtful and appreciated! We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and would stay here again for sure. Thank you Susan!

This place was so beautiful. Everything was as pictured. About 15 minutes from downtown Napa. Great neighborhood.
It was clean and well kept.
Susan was always helpful.

This cottage was wonderful and even better than we could have hoped for. Totally private space on the property with tons of natural light and very spacious. It’s in the neighborhood of Vallejo, which has some activities that Susan suggested and we had a great time. It’s also an easy ferry ride or drive to San Francisco, which is always a great visit. All in all, we give everything about this stay a 10/10. We will miss this place for sure! It was so comfortable, cozy and perfect for us.
Vallejo’s hidden gem. I enjoyed the stay at the cottage. Susan provided a clean space and lots of snacks. It was the perfect getaway.
Susan was terrific and her quaint cottage is great for a short visit to Vallejo. Nice space for a short remote working stay

We stayed here for about 3 weeks. Susan was so thoughtful, from the goodies when we arrived, to her responsiveness when we needed anything. The cottage is beautiful and cozy. The neighborhood has a great area to walk/run in (not a lot of sidewalks, but not a lot of cars either). Vallejo is great for its proximity to San Francisco, Sonoma/Napa and Yosemite.
Absolutely beautiful property. Susan was an exceptional host and was attentive to all of our needs. Cannot recommend enough.

There’s probably not a whole lot I can add on top of what’s already been said. But in short, this is a terrific place to stay in Vallejo. Best neighborhood, quick and reliable communication, really nice and cute space/ relaxing backyard, great WiFi for long term stays/ working from home, and really kind and generous host. If there’s anything that could be improved it’s more storage space for long term stays, especially for clothes and kitchen stuff. But still undoubtedly 5/5, thanks for the terrific stay Susan!
This is a great place to be close to wine country (and get a driver!). Susan is an excellent host and her place is so charming. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone!

I won’t be able to say enough good things about this place. Susan greeted us when we arrived and was very friendly and helpful. The cottage was clean, comfortable, well-stocked and well-maintained. It's very cute, and Susan's garden outside the window gives it a lovely, idyllic feel.
Place was beautiful! Great distance from the bay as well as napa valley, it is gorgeous and easy to access. Would definitely recommend!

I was a guest at this Airbnb for 14 weeks and I am very pleased with my stay. Susan and Tom were very kind, respectful, and quick to answer any questions and fix anything that needed attention. I enjoyed the privacy and security this place offered; I parked in the driveway and had keycode access to the backyard where I used another code to enter the cottage. I felt safe staying alone and had no issues. The cottage was very clean when I arrived and fully stocked as indicated on the cottage description. Susan and Tom provided a lengthy list of things to do/places to eat in and outside of Vallejo. I did enjoy that the cottage was near many popular stores and restaurants. I would highly recommend this Airbnb to those visiting Vallejo. The only challenge I came across was using a minifridge for 14 weeks. I had plenty of room in the fridge when it was just myself there, however, when I had guests I wished I had more fridge space. Having a freezer would have been nice but I lived without it just fine. I highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking to stay in Vallejo as it was clean, safe, charming, and run by wonderful hosts!

Susan's place is lovely - we stayed there for a couple of months with our infant son and had a wonderful time. It has everything we needed and was very comfortable - especially appreciated having the backyard/garden! Susan was a great host, excellent communication from start to finish and so helpful with making sure we had everything we needed. We had some trouble with the internet upon arrival and she immediately worked with us to make sure it was resolved. Highly recommend staying here!
Beautiful, immaculately clean, and in cute little neighborhood. The hosts were really great about checking in, and I just had a fantastic time.
Susan's cottage was very cozy, had everything we needed, and was a great central location to explore the Marin coast and East Bay Area.
I loved staying here! Everything was as described and I really appreciated the thoughtful amenities provided. I highly recommend this place!
a very beautiful place.

Susan’s cottage is the perfect little getaway for you and your significant other or a couple close friends. It’s surrounded by a beautiful garden that’s sure to have you feeling connected to Mother Nature, especially considering that there isn’t any AC so you’re likely to keep the windows open most of the time. There are a lot of well placed windows and a fan to help with circulation so you really don’t the lack of air conditioning. My boyfriend and I worked out of the cottage for a week without any issues and felt quite at home with all of the personalized touches. There was a bottle of wine waiting for us when we arrived, along with a couple of other snacks that ended up coming in very handy! We ran into a couple spiders during our stay but nothing major, to be expected with a garden as nice as hers. Check in is easy and really flexible but be prepared to check out promptly at 11 or maybe even a little earlier as she is likely to have another guest arriving later that day. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend booking this place. We didn’t run into Susan at all but nonetheless she was still very helpful.
Awesome

This was a fantastic find for us. It’s 20 min from Sonoma Raceway and a great place to jump into any wine tasting trips you’d like to make. The place is very clean and our hosts left us snacks and wine, which was unexpected and very much appreciated. Parking is super easy, right in front of the main house. We’d definitely stay here again. I can’t recommend this place enough.
Susan's was a great host. Her little cottage was clean, quite, easy to access in the back of the main house. I would recommend this place for long stays and short stays. Easy to access I-80.
A lovely place to get to know the area!

Amazing garden and cozy little cottage makes getting to know the Solano county area really nice!! Waking up to a beautiful garden and was such a mood changer, and I had a 2 year old with me who absolutely loved pointing out the beautiful flowers. It was a lovely place to stay while getting familiar with the area.

A great one-month housing experience, the house is very comfortable and quiet. Because my child played basketball outside the house, they also specifically found him a basketball hoop. Thanks Susan. Be sure to stay next time.
Great stay, super clean, very friendly and very comfortable bed, nice neighborhood and would recommend the spot to anyone.

It was an amazing place that made us so comfortable and cozy! Susan was so nice to give us a care package. This cottage had everything to make us feel at home. Nicely decorated, clean, great location, easy check-in process. We’ll definitely stay again when we come back.

Susan is a great host. The house had everything i needed. She even leaves some food and coffee for the guest when you arrive. I also appreciated her letting me put a large tray of food in her fridge for a work party
I always felt safe and secure, staying by myself. Parking is SO easy, off the beaten track but still easy access. And it’s just so quiet !

Susan’s place was perfect for our little Napa/Sonoma trip. It’s a super cute cottage with extremely thoughtful amenities. It’s about 50 minutes away from the wineries, but honestly worth the drive as Susans place is well priced for what you get. She provided us with a long list of recommendations which was really sweet. Would definitely recommend and stay again!
Cozy cottage, very clean.
I highly recommend staying at Susan's place. It's so quiet, peaceful, comfortable. It gets better every time I stay there. I love staying at her home and will be back soon!
Susan was a great host! This is a very nice, clean place to stay close to the Napa wineries. The extra amenities were very thoughtful and super appreciated!

This is a darling little place and a great spot for a single person or couple. The living space is great with lots of amenities. So, I suggest you make plans to enjoy some time on the cottage to relax or cook.
The bedroom is functional -- but if you are over six feet tall, be ready to hunch over or hit your head as you walk around the bed. I would call this a mild annoyance, but something to keep in mind.
Comfortable bed, easy access to the space, and all as expected. Appreciated the extra touches such as the wine/snacks.
A fantastic space with very hospitable hosts. Was close enough to the wedding we attended, yet also a manageable distance to head into the city for a night. Highly recommended!
Good space and appreciated the bottle of wine and cookies. Easy check in process.

We had a wedding to attend but this place would be AMAZING if you were planning a Napa/Sonoma/SFO trip. It is centrally located AND easy to get onto a freeway. Susan is lovely. I only wish the weather had been better so we could sit outside and sip our coffee in her lovely backyard.
All around great.

Susan was an amazing host. The communication was excellent. Let her know that I was planning on proposing in Napa that weekend and she made sure everything was perfect. Such a good spot for a couple to stay. Good jumping off point for wine country. Only 20 mins or so to downtown Napa. No complaints. Loved everything!

Susan's place is tucked away in a nice suburb about 30 minutes away from downtown Napa. It's a quaint little place that is full of lush greenery on the outside. On the inside everything is up to date and has a fair amount of space for two people. The bed upstairs is incredibly comfy as well! Further, Susan is quick to respond to any questions you may have over the weekend and extends great hospitality to her guests.

Lovely cottage and lovely host! :) Very nice amenities. Cute loft bedroom with stairs - watch your head with the slanted ceilings, just on the sides, but really nice room, with a cozy armchair and VERY comfy bed!! Private little home all to yourself, in great location - perfect for visiting the marina in Vallejo. Mare Island is fun, too! Nice drive to Napa, also! We had a wonderful stay!! :) :)

Susan's guest cottage is a great place to stay when exploring the Napa Valley. The Netflix was much appreciated, and the fruit, wine, salami, cheese, coffee cream, and tea were an amazing touch. We immediately felt at home, and wished we could have stayed longer.

Susan's place is great, charming, well appointed with everything you need. Susan added the nicest personalized touches which made us feel welcomed and a bit spoiled. Would definitely return as the place is great and Susan is a great host!
Don't pass this up. You'll love the privacy and amenities!

We loved staying here. The place is lovely, Susan is a wonderful hostess. The location is perfect as you seem to be in the centre between San Francisco and Napa! Safe , quiet neighbourhood...and was able to pick fresh oranges and lemons from the back yard! For a Canadian that was stellar.....when returning to this area we will definitely be wanting to stay here again. Thank you so much, Susan.

This comfortable cottage is located in a beautiful, quiet neighborhood. The kitchen is well-stocked with everything we needed to cook pasta, as well as good wine glasses and a hot water boiler that we used to make our coffee. The shower has good water pressure and the bed is remarkably comfortable. There were additional food items not mentioned in the description that were pleasantly surprising. Access is easy, and the hosts are responsive and nonintrusive. Hope to return soon!
Susan and Nick were my angels. I lived at their place for many months and felt at home. I hope to return for Season 4 of our TV series! I love this space soooo much!!!!! Thank you thank you! Xoxox

Susan's cottage is lovely place to rest your head, with a gorgeous garden to look out onto in the morning. The bed was extremely comfy and the english muffins were a very sweet touch. Great central location when visiting NorCal with easy access to both wine country and the city.
Thanks for having us Susan!
It’s a great spot.

Our stay was really nice! We used this location to go to a music festival in Napa and the location was not too far! The house was perfect for a great getaway- plenty of room to hang out at the house, the utmost cleanliness, full amenities, a comfy bed, and great local food options. Plus the hosts were beyond gracious and helpful! Would highly recommend it!

Overall, this cottage is perfectly located to go to San Francisco or Napa; a nice place to escape the busyness of San Francisco. Based on the property profile, I expected breakfast at least being offered. We did not see the owners at all, much less being invited to breakfast. We did have a package of English Muffins, butter, and strawberries in the cottage when we arrived.
Everyone vacations differently but for us, we like to wind down in the evening by watching TV. The cable service to this cottage is extremely limited and there is no DVD player. They do provide an HDMI cable so if you are so inclined, bring your laptop to connect.
We loved the place. Susan provided us with English muffins, cheese, strawberries, and yogurt. The place was quiet and clean and very spacious. Would definitely stay again!

This cottage is quaint, clean and quiet. It was perfect for us, especially since we were working just a few miles away. The bathroom is wonderful, including the shower head and the shower in general. It is well stocked.
The only complaint that I have is that the kitchen is very small, and there is no oven. This is only important if you are planning to invite people over.
In general, the large bedroom, which is sort of a loft, is large and nice. The downstairs is just one room, but it serves as a living room / dining room / kitchen, and it, too, is very large. Susan's house was perfect for us!

This is my 2nd visit at this lovely home. I feel safe and secure. My kitty loves it - so many little spots to explore. For me - wine, fruit, juice boxes, shampoo, conditioner, nice towels & sheets and comfy pillows. Really, too many little touches to name, but I'm so grateful for every single one of them. Thank you for another great stay!

My stay at Susan's guest house was wonderful! My favorite part was relaxing in a chaise lounge in the backyard; it was just so lovely to sit among their beautiful landscaping and garden, reading my book while listening to the leaves rustling in the wind, and watching the squirrels and birds. It was so peaceful I actually took a nap! I appreciated that some food, wine, and beer were provided. Beware, the bed was heavenly...you might not want to get out of it! The sheets and the towels were luxurious too. Thanks for a great stay!
Hosts are very friendly, but respected our privacy. Clean, quiet and private.

The perfect jumping point for our Bay area travels!! My Mom and I were on a mother and daughter trip and truly enjoyed our stay at the cottage! The drive to Napa was simple, the town of Vallejo is quaint, the scenery was beautiful, and San Francisco less than an hour drive! Hosts are very responsive when asking for recommendations and when an issue did arise, it was taken care of in minutes! The sun shining in the kitchen window was magnificent as we enjoyed our morning tea and muffins! We would recommend to those looking for a nice get away, centrally located but peaceful! Thanks again Susan and Nick!
A warm cottage to relax at the end of an adventure. My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

This beautiful cottage was perfect for me. I needed a quiet, safe place while working on a project in Vallejo and this was it. It was private,
comfortable and affordable. Thank you, Susan!!
Susan was wonderful from the beginning, communication and all. The place is super relaxed and quiet which is just what I was looking for. My mother and I loved our stay. Thank you so very much!
Susan and Nick's cottage was great. Very roomie, clean and cozy. The pictures are very accurate. It is close to Napa, about a 20 minute drive. They are excellent hosts! Love this place!
Great place to stay. Not too far from Napa.

We caught a flight from London to Oakland and then hired a car to drive to the cottage. The drive took us 1 1/2 hours in rush hour traffic to find the property. The cottage is in the garden of the main house.
Property was as described in the photos clean and comfortable. The bedroom was very large and had an extremely comfortable bed. There was plenty of outside parking.
We used the property as a base to visit family in Fairfield.
We ate at the Dirty Fish which was excellent and walked to the market and had breakfast at the Good Day cafe. Catching ferry to San Francisco very easy and convenient. Enjoyed walking along the waterfront in Vallejo. Also found the local bar Kesslers which took us under 10 minutes to walk, the night we were they had live bar

Susan’s cottage is a great place to stay just steps from wine country. It’s a short drive from Vallejo to Napa where we toured the world class wineries. The cottage was well stocked and clean while being quite spacious. Susan was a great host. She was very helpful with special requests as well as providing recommendations and information regarding our excursions.

I can't say enough positive things about our experience with the cottage and Susan. We arrived for our honeymoon and unfortunately came during the fires. Susan was so helpful and understanding when we were scrambling to make new plans. Her cottage was beautiful, bed comfortable, quiet neighborhood, and the hospitality couldn't be beat. We will definitely re-book - wish we could have stayed!

Susan's backyard cottage is the perfect place to relax after a day of wine tasting. The location is great and really easy to get to no matter which direction you are coming from. Coffee and a light breakfast were provided and the welcoming bottle of wine was a lovely extra touch.
Clean and cozy. Love it!
This cottage was the perfect location in between San Francisco and Napa. Susan provided breakfast items/essentials and a bottle of wine! We felt very comfortable and enjoyed our stay!
Susans friendlyness and hospitality, perfect location for many activities. A safe whole home for yourselves which is very kozy,spacious and beautiful.

Lovely house to stay at with very reasonable price. Great location and host is very accommodating. Just be aware of a big garden in front of the house for pollen allergy issues. Other than that, this place is a gem! 👍

Susan's place is beautiful, clean, and just as it looks.
There was a minor issue when I arrived, and she took care of it right away.
Thank you Susan for being so wonderful!

Susan and Nick's Wine Country Cottage is absolutely perfect as a home base to explore Napa and Sonoma, a reasonable drive or ferry to San Fransisco (GORGEOUS to take from the city at night!), and set in a lush garden setting that will make you feel so at home. Susan was super clear on instructions for check in and the house, welcomed us warmly with a bottle of wine and breakfast items for the morning, even helped us decide on the best transportation options given our arrival times in the city on a holiday weekend. We absolutely loved staying and recommend for anyone looking for a great alternative to spending all your wine tasting and city exploring monies on accommodations, this was an AWESOME value and super sweet place to stay! Also of particular interest- the temperatures were over 100 degrees each day with excessive heat warnings and advisories and with the circulation and tons of screened in open windows the house was comfortable every time we walked in. MUST in the city: Sweet Maple for brekky/brunch and SFMOMA (wow.); in Napa: Turnbull Winery (ask for Tyler) and Napa Live (live music crawl downtown); in Sonoma: WestWineTours with Garrett in his VW bus was an absolute weekend highlight and a definite high recommendation (also available as an Air BnB experience and worth every penny). Thanks so much Susan and Nick for setting us up so pretty to enjoy this Wine Country Weekend!

I loved this spot. It's in a great location for going south to the Bay Area or north to Wine Country, and the cottage is nestled near a truly beautiful garden. I was very comfortable and wish I could have stayed longer!
Great, clean place to stay. Loved the garden and everything was fabulous!

Absolutely wonderful place to stay. The cottage is located in a beautiful and quiet garden, close to Napa, and a quick car or ferry ride to San Francisco. Susan has thought of everything!!! We will be recommending the cottage to our friends and family!

The Cottage was perfect. We flew into SFO for a wedding in Napa and the Cottage was perfectly located. We were out of the hustle and bustle of SF, but close enough to visit friends there. We were also close enough to Napa that we took a couple day trips to nearby sites.
Susan's suggestions for food and "to see's" were very helpful. The space was clean and her garden is beautiful. I would absolutely recommend this place to friends. Thank you Susan!
Nice & cozy place to stay with a beautiful backyard. Close to Napa valley and now to busy of a place like San Francisco.

This is a charming, private cottage nestled in a fairytale garden behind the larger home. Susan and Nick have put a lot of care into every detail of the place including a luxurious comforter and sheets; and a few items in the mini fridge. The bed is a tempurpedic type mattress which I don't care for but if you do, you'll be set! I wish there was a tub but the shower was awesome! The bedroom is upstairs in an attic room above the garage. If you are really tall watch your head! The location is awesome. We were a short drive to Napa for a wine tour and a ferry ride to San Fransisco. One downside was the wifi which was problematic at times so we used our hotspot. The neighborhood was hilly which made for some nice walks with our pup. We can def recommend this place!
Great place. Susan is super nice.
The cottage is nice and spacious, set in a lovely garden space. Susan and Nick were really friendly and provided excellent information and communication.

Susan was friendly and helpful. The place is ok, but the bed and the polyester sheets were uncomfortable. Good value for the price, but it could do with an upgrade of the furniture, specially the sofa, which is too small.

Susan's place darn near perfect! Great jumping off point to the Napa and Sonoma Valleys and San Francisco by ferry. Space was clean, unique and the breakfast foods that greet you on arrival are just what you need in the morning. Would 1000% stay here again.
Thank you for allowing us to bring our puppy, Ramesses. We all loved your intimate garden and enjoyed a refreshing departure from the big city.

Susan's place is located in the cutest area, close to everything you'd possibly need access to. The cottage is warm and comfortable and it opens up to the most magical garden ever. Thank you for hosting is here!
The place is very charming. The pictures and descriptions are very accurate. I would've loved a larger fridge, but its so minor compare to all the other great things the place has to offer.

My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at the cottage during our weekend Napa trip. It was the perfect place for us, clean, bright, private, quiet, spacious and very comfortable, it had everything we needed and we felt right at home. Susan and Nick have a beautiful garden which was a treat. It was very thoughtful of them to leave some goodies in the fridge for us, even though there were stores close by. Communication was easy and responsive, and she was very accommodating with our check in and check out time. The neighborhood is quiet but only 5 minutes or less from the main highway, which we took to and from Napa, only about 20 minutes or so, very convenient. We would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.

Susan's place was great! She had goodies in the fridge, the place was clean, organized and well kept. The fountain in the garden was great to fall asleep to at night. We would recommend this place to anyone looking to explore the Bay Area!

The cottage was adorable and pretty spacious. The pictures are very accurate and I loved the little fridge snacks and bottle of wine left for us! The bed was extremely comfortable and Susan was very flexible about our check-in time! I would definitely recommend this cottage and this host!

My niece and her boyfriend stayed at Susan's place while visiting me in Napa. They loved it! The space was airy and bright and Susan's restaurant suggestions were excellent. We would love to return some day.

Susan's place is perfect! She was kind of enough to stock the fridge with some light breakfast snacks and made sure we had everything we needed. The cottage was cozy, clean, and spacious. We really liked the location of this cottage because it was in a quiet neighborhood but close enough to the freeway so that we could hop right on. It was also really close to surrounding cities, 20 minutes from Napa, 30-40 from SF and Berkeley.

Susan and Nick's cottage was an absolute pleasure to stay at. We loved that we had our own private space and that the space was cozy and welcoming to boot - perfect for sipping wine in the evenings when you're settling down. The space was clean and not a hair was out of place. We loved the little kitchen and were so thankful to have it at our disposal. The loft like bedroom was another plus that made that space incredibly fun to stay at. Susan was also incredibly quick to respond to any inquiries I had (and there were many!). She was also helpful in recommending restaurants and areas to visit! The location of the cottage was perfect considering we visited Napa, Sonoma, Berkeley, San Francisco, San Jose, Concord and Oakland during our stay. We're excited for the next time we have to visit the Northern California region, because now we have a great place to stay for next time!
This adorable cottage is a short drive from Napa and the wine country. Vallejo can be explored from the waterfront to old town. Your hostess is generous and kind.
The cottage was super cute and Susan was a lovely host! Everything was set up for us and clearly communicated, we had a great time.

Can't say enough about Susan and Nick. I had the unfortunate experience of arriving later Friday evening to a suitcase that had been tampered with en route. Could not get the TSA lock open. Susan happened to be in the cottage and wasted no time in enlisting her husbands expertise. He not only successfully got my suitcase open, he then offered to drive me to meet my friends (due to lock, I had to wait behind). Their garden is beautiful and I wish we'd had time to sit outside and enjoy the flowers and foliage. I highly recommend this cottage and the wonderful hosts.

Susan's cottage is wonderful. So homey and relaxing and perfect for our stay. Susan is such a thoughtful and kind host who's included all the details for everything you could possibly need during your stay from coffee to wine. It's a great location that's easy to get to from SF and a short distance from the wineries.
Thanks so much for everything Susan!

What a precious gem not too far from Napa/Sonoma wine country! Susan was a lovely host and always responded extremely fast when I had any inquiries. The cottage is truly a charming resting place after a long day of exploring wineries… And the best part… You can bring your furry friend! Everything was so comfortable… We always slept well. It's very spacious and you can really make yourself at home for however long your stay is. It is gated so you can let your dog go out and wander to smell her pretty flowers ..
Susan came to greet us on our first night upon arrival and she was so very helpful, recommending all kinds of wineries (and even offering coupons! Yea! Gets expensive tasting all that wine! :) ) and other fun things to do like the ferry to San Francisco ..
There were some yogurt and English muffins with jam and even a bottle of wine that greeted us. We made very good use of those. ;)
You can hit a winery in 20 minutes. Our favorite was Turnbull! Excellent. (Unpretentious, down to earth and did I mention the AMAZING wine?)
Needless to say, we had an amazing experience and always loved returning to Susan's precious wine country cottage to relax and prepare for the next day of adventures in winetasting. :)

Great location for exploring Napa. Very clean, safe, and private cottage with plenty of amenities for additional comfort. Susan was a great host with excellent suggestions for restaurants, wineries, and attractions (she even gave us coupons!). Parking and access is easy and well lit. It was the perfect place for our trip.

Susan did a wonderful job of welcoming us. She left some personal touches and was very considerate of us when she thought there may be inconveniences with the weather. Susan made herself available when needed but also gave us the privacy we needed. We enjoyed our stay very much!

The cottage was perfect for our stay. It was centrally located between wine country and San Francisco. We took Susan and Nick's advice on taking the ferry to San Francisco and it worked out perfectly. We ate at 2 restaurants they recommended and both were wonderful. We had complete privacy, but they were available if we needed them. We would highly recommend this Airbnb and would definitely stay here again.
Great communication and was a very easy and convenient stay.

This is an amazing apartment. I love that the bedroom is kind of like a loft on the second floor. Super cute. We only stayed one night but definitely could've cooked in house had it been a longer stay. It was very comfortable and nice to have our own access at the back of Susan's property. She also allowed us to change the dates of our stay with a couple weeks notice which was very helpful. Thank you!!
Cozy space and very smooth check in/out. Susan had many things prepared for us upon arrival. We would love to stay another time!

This was such a charming and lovely place. It had everything you could possibly need including cheese and wine and the most beautiful surroundings. We were in town for a wedding and it was the perfect spot for that and for wine tasting the following day. You seriously can't go wrong here! It is spectacular!

Susan is a wonderful host. Her hospitality started before I arrived with her providing answers to my many questions. When we arrived everything was exactly the way described. Susan stopped by just to confirm everything was satisfactory. Her genuine concern for the comfort of her guests is heartwarming. We knew we could let her know if there was anything we might need. She also provided written information about local places for dining. I highly recommend Wine Country Cottage as a warm, friendly and "home away from home" to the San Francisco/Napa Valley area. I have already booked a second stay, and am looking forward to it.
We had a fantastic stay! The hosts were gracious, the home just perfect for us and the location was ideal for eating, relaxing, hiking and generally exploring. I can't recommend staying here enough.

Our stay was perfect! Everything was exactly as described, and better than we could have imagined. The location is great as it is super close to the SF ferry and a quick drive to napa. We would definitely stay here again!
Susan's guest cottage was comfortable, quiet, clean, and above all charming. It's a great base for exploring Napa and an oasis to return to at the end of the day. Highly recommend.

The guest house in Vallejo was excellent for my business trip needs. It is perfectly located in a very nice area of Vallejo and is a very spacious and charming space. Susan and Nick were both very kind and helpful and I would absolutely stay there again.

The host was very quick in responding to our inquiries. Although we never actually met she left us some excellent suggestions as to where to eat. I loved the layout of the place and the decor. the garden from the kitchen window was lovely.

Susan and Nick's cottage was perfect for my stay in the Vallejo/Napa area! The cottage was clean, very comfortable, and very nicely decorated. It was a beautiful oasis in the middle of a residential area and felt very safe. The shared yard was lovely to look upon when at the kitchen sink.
Susan and Nick were graceful hosts and very, very accommodating. They were available to offer information and a nice conversation, yet they didn't intrude and you felt your area was quite private.
I would definitely recommend this place to others seeking a sweet cottage close to wine country, san francisco, and other bay locations.

Susan was super friendly upon our arrival. Her place was spacious and clean for the two of us. Her backyard was lovely to walk through to get to the cottage. Enjoyed everything about it including the 2 for 1 wine tasting coupon she gave us!

I spent several ours on AirBnB looking for a place that we could stay while we were doing some business travel up in the east bay area. Susan and Nick's guest house stood out to me because it looked so tidy and beautiful, prepared with intention and kindness. We found this spot to exceed our expectations---and felt like we truly found a "home-away-from-home." The bed was SO comfortable and we enjoyed cooking a few meals on the kitchen that was equipped with all we needed. As I cooked a few meals I had the privilege of looking out the windows at their Eden-like backyard---breathtaking. Oh, and their hospitality was superior. Being in their peaceful home was a true gift. As we made the long drive home to Los Angeles after a long week of work, we were refreshed, connected, and grateful for this retreat space that let us feel like we never left home. The neighborhood is so nice, neighbors walked by with warm greetings, parking was easy and the energy of this couple and their home is quite beautiful, full of warmth. Sweet people with a perfect spot! Thank you!
My friends and I had a very comfortable stay at Susan and Nick's cottage. The keypad lock made checking in a breeze. The neighborhood was quiet and we had everything we needed.
Very neat little cabin with complete privacy. Susan was very personable and available for help. Great host and great experience overall!

Susan's space worked well for our group. It's a separate guesthouse in the back yard - not attached to the main house. Definitely roomy enough for 4 people. It was well stocked with toilet paper, paper towels, linens and soap and shampoo. I would stay here again
My family stayed at Susan's for a wedding on Mare Island in Vallejo. We loved her cottage. It was easily accessible, quiet and comfortable.

Comfortable cottage located in back of a home in a quiet neighborhood in Valle Vista area in Vallejo. It's convenient to freeway entrance and any shopping you need.
You walk into an open space with the dining, living and kitchen area in view. Bathroom is on the same level.
Kitchen has a gas stove, mini fridge, toaster oven and microwave convection oven. Kitchen essentials are provided for cooking your meals if you decided to stay-in and eat. I cooked the entire two days of my stay.
Walk up a few steps into the bedroom located on top of the garage. The attic room has a queen bed with ample space for another bed. A cozy chair with ottoman is located in the corner for a nice restful read before you sleep. Plenty of blankets and linens are provided.
I met Nick in person. He was very nice and made me feel comfortable. Anything we needed he was always quick to respond. I communicated with Susan via Airbnb. She was also quick to response with anything we needed. They were very quiet and I almost thought they were never home.
Although this place is located on the same property of someone's home, it felt very private. This is a place we would definitely stay again.

We spent a week in the region to attend our son's wedding and meet up with some old friends in Napa for wine tasting. Susan's place is much bigger than we expected, and it has all we needed to stay comfortably for 6 nights. It is conveniently located near the wedding venue in and it's only less than 30 minutes drive from Napa. It is on a quiet street with easy street parking in front of the house. I like the view from the kitchen window in the morning when the beautiful flower garden is basking in the soft sunlight. Thank Susan and Nic for making our stay a blissful experience.

I've stayed at several Airbnb locations and this was one of my favorites. I thoroughly enjoyed my time there and wished I could have stayed longer. The Cottage is just as nice as the photos and the location is in a lovely, quiet neighborhood. There's a beautiful garden area right outside the front door, which added to the charm. Thanks to the hosts, Susan and Nick for a great stay!

Susan's place was very quaint and served us well. We stayed for two nights and met both her and her husband who were warm. The one complaint was the lack of curtains to maintain privacy in some parts of the place. Other than that, it was very good and Susan was a great host.

I stayed at Susan's cottage over the weekend with my mom. It was very well maintained and perfectly clean. It was easy to get to and from the area by car and was exactly what we hoped the stay would be like. Upon arriving we had some trouble with getting through the back door but Susan quickly responded by phone and helped us out with instructions (she was away from her home at the time). We never met with Susan but had a pleasant stay.

We had a great time staying at Susan's cottage. This cottage is detached from the main house and has an open living/dining/kitchen area downstairs and a loft bedroom upstairs. We were a party of 4 adults and 1 toddler and we didn't feel cramped. The cottage was clean and well-lit, with a small refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave oven and toaster oven. Susan left us a bottle of wine and a box of croissants (yum!) + a few other items in the mini-fridge. The cottage itself is located in a quiet neighborhood in Vallejo, not too far from wine country (Napa/ Sonoma) and not too far from downtown Vallejo.

We barely saw our hosts as we were out most of the time, visiting breweries, wineries and other local attractions. Susan's recommendations were good - we especially enjoyed the Mare Island brewery at the Vallejo ferry terminal building and the Rutherford Ranch Winery. She even left us a discount coupon for the winery!

Overall, we had an excellent experience and would recommend staying at Susan's cottage if you want a relaxing vacation near wine country or if you want to experience any of the other attractions of the area.

My boyfriend and I didn't get to meet Susan face to face, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The entry is a kepyad, so there was no need to meet for key exchanges. Also, we're professional travellers always on the go with ideas of places we want to hit, so there was no need to "hold our hands" so to speak. Susan did leave us a sheet of great food recommendations (several of which we did try-thanks Susan!) We were also pleased to come home in the evening to some complimentary goodies that we greatly enjoyed and appreciated. The place looks just like in the pictures and is in a nice, quiet neighborhood away from the Napa craziness but close enough to get where you need to go. Extremely cozy and comfortable. I would definitely recommend.
Susan's cottage war very nice and Susan very helpful, and nice.

Our host Susan was wonderful! She was very helpful and clear in her communication as far as instructions. She also made sure to give us great recommendations and even offered us some coupons for some local wineries! The neighborhood is quiet, clean and very pleasant. It was our first experience with airbnb that really gave us that traditional bnb feel. It really felt cozy and comforting to feel like we were almost at home. The cottage was very clean, tidy, well stocked with supplies and there were even little snacks for us! Very well thought out home, will definitely recommend for future stays!

I enjoyed my stay. The hosts were very thoughtful and extremely accommodating. The space was clean and looked exactly like the pictures. I would strongly encourage potential guests to stay at the property.

Susan's place was just as pictured! We truly enjoyed the cottage feel. What isn't in the description is the cute garden you pass through on your way to entering the house. The bed was extra comfortable. We have a tv in out bedroom and that was a concern for me but once we got inside and relaxed no tv was needed. The shower was great with good pressure.
We enjoyed our stay. The cottage is clean, spacious, comfortable and provided everything we needed. Very nice set up!

The pictures, etc on the website very much matched the reality.

Very comfortable and quiet. Being close to grocery shopping was very convenient. We walked to Food Maxx.
Susa's place was just wonderful. I can easily live there. Thank you again Susan.

Susan's cottage felt just like home - the space was private, clean and so comfortable. Susan herself was very accommodating to us and we are so thankful! She had lots of special touches that helped it feel like home. Thanks again Susan!

Had a wonderful 1-month stay at this cottage - had more than enough space for myself, partner, and our chocolate lab. Kitchen came well-stocked, plenty to cook with during our stay. Hosts were very friendly and helpful. Great place for an extended stay for us in a nice neighborhood!

We had a wonderful stay at Susan's cottage! It was just as pictured and made for a great Thanksgiving for my little family. It was an easy drive to Napa and all the wineries. The cottage was very clean and comfortable. The towels in the bathroom made you feel like you were in a luxury hotel. Susan's husband even found my son a charger for his Macbook which made his trip happier. We are very thankful for Susan sharing her home and cat :-)
Susan's place is clean and homey. We enjoyed our stay and proximity to the wineries - and also appreciated some of the snacks Susan left to welcome us!

This property is exactly as advertised! Spacious, tastefully appointed, comfortable, and quiet. We "cooked-in" most nights and the kitchen had most everything we needed including a dishwasher. We would highly recommend this cottage as your base for exploring the wine country - considerably more affordable than options actually in the Napa Valley (which has become excessively overpriced).
The cottage is clean, quiet and well equipped.
Really very lovely accommodations. Our host, Susan, was very communicative and helpful. She goes the extra distance to make guests feel welcome. Thanks Susan!

I stayed there with my parents for a weekend at the Wine Country and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. Susan's cottage is a lovely place in a nice and quiet neighbourhood in Vallejo, a quick drive away from wineries in Napa and Sonoma.
Everything was very well organized, the kitchen had all the supplies needed to cook comfortably and there were also supplies for breakfast and even a bottle of wine! The street also had lots of parking spaces. The place looks just like the pictures!
Checking in and out was very easy as they have coded gate and doors with codes they change to every guest, takes away the hassle of keys and stuff, a nice touch!
I, unfortunately, didn't get to meet Susan because she was sick, but she always replied to my questions quickly and was very helpful. She also gave great recommendations of where to eat near us! Her husband, Nick, paid a visit to us on our second night to make sure we were ok and welcome us, he was very nice!
Definitely recommended!
Our group of 4 enjoyed the cottage very much. It was a convenient location for us and fit our needs well.
This cottage was so nice and adorable! The pictures were exactly accurate. We were super close to the ferry that takes you straight into san fran. My sister, doggie and i had a lovely experience!

We enjoyed very much your apparment,it was like home,very well equipped and cozy.We would give you a 10/10 évaluation.
Gérard and Elyse

Our experience at the cottage was wonderful! Our party of 4 traveling from San Francisco to visit Napa were all extremely pleased with the overall space and ease of access. One couple stayed in the upstairs bedroom while the second stayed on an air mattress. There was more than enough space for us to spread out and relax while not sleeping. Downtown Napa was a 20 minute drive even with traffic so this was a perfect location for our trip to wine country. The grocery store was right around the corner which allowed us to purchase breakfast and dinner items and enjoy them in the cottage. The owner's home is in the front yard, but the owners were extremely pleasant and helpful. I would highly recommend this unit for anyone looking to visit Napa with a party of 4 or less.
Highly recommend this place, very clean , safe, was ver easy to communicate with Stephanie.
Thank you! Stephanie was great
Incredible place and a very nice lady. Would recommend to anyone. Definitely get your money worth. Thanks again!
Sheer delght
Lovely, historic home that feels like a real B&B. Birds chirping in a beautiful garden where you can pick your own oranges!

We enjoyed our stay in Vallejo at Kay’s Place. Kay was very sweet to us and answered any questions we had for her. Her house has a lot of history and is centrally located to so many things to see and do. Thank you Kay for having us !!! 😁
I stay here a few days once a month for work and feel right at home each time. Dr. Kay is very responsive and ensures it is a pleasant stay.

Dr. Kay is a kind host and her home is a lovely place to stay. We were able to check in late and check out early which was extremely helpful for us since we were on a tight schedule with a lot of travel. The home and neighborhood were very quiet. Also very affordable. I would happily book this room again if I found myself in north bay again!

Kay was an extremely attentive and friendly host. She was kind enough to make up with our late check-in, and was very available. The bedroom is very comfortable, even though the bed may seem narrow in the land of king size beds! But it reminded us of ours in France;))
The house is extremely charming and full of beautiful antique objects. We regret that we only spent a few hours sleeping there. Everything is thought out to make the stay enjoyable: water carafe available, kettle, mugs and tea bags...
Excellent value for money!
Great host, comfortable room and lovely garden.
We so enjoyed our stay and look forward to our next visit.
I had a wonderful stay at Kay's place. Lovely room and very clean. She is very hospitable. Thanks Kay!

Originally we had booked Dr. Kay's place only for a day & we ended up extending it by another day.
The place is beautiful & nicely done. Napa valley is about 30 min drive from here. Definitely recommended.
The house is a bit old & hence the floor is squeaky. The itself has a small fridge, microwave and basic cutlery. Dr. Kay helped us with restaurant & wine tasting recommendations.
Overall, highly recommend this place!
Beautiful and historical. A wonderful stop over. Dr. Kay is very kind and accommodating.

Like everyone else says, Dr. Kay is a kind and thoughtful host. I was very comfortable at her home. I used this as my base and explored one nearby city per day: Napa, Sonoma, Calistoga and St. Helena. As you can see I checked the cities that are closer to Vallejo first before driving up north to Calistoga during the last two days of my trip. I didn't feel rushed and the entire stay felt calm and peaceful. I would love to go back and stay here!

Dr. Kay was an amiable host! Her home was beautiful, quiet, and very cozy. We felt right at home. The rooms for guests are upstairs, and because we were the only guests, it felt very private and comfortable. But if there had been another person, we would have had to share the bathroom. That would not be a problem at all, but it's worth noting! Dr. Kay also allowed us to pick fresh oranges from her tree, which were delicious! I highly recommend staying with Dr. Kay if you're visiting Napa Valley. The home is about 30ish minutes away from Yountville. Overall, it was a lovely home with a gracious host!
A wonderful cozy stay. Felt very peaceful and safe. Dr Kay was very welcoming and kind

Great air b and b for a night! Dr.Kay was super sweet and flexible with our check in. We enjoyed picking oranges from her back yard. Very quaint and unique home. She gave some great recommendations and safety tips for the area we were in.

Her place was such a calm and tranquil hug after a long drive as I was preparing to continue my journey the next day. The garden was peaceful and the room cozy. It was such an honor to be her guest. Thank you.

Dr Kay
Is a wonderful host. I enjoyed our conversation about her making the move to Vallejo when she was my age and about her opening the home to artists to tap into their creative talents.
My stay was very short but next time I too would love to visit during warmer weather and sit in the lovely garden to tap into my gifts.
Thank you Dr Kay for sharing your adobe. 💜
It was amazing!
What a special place to stay. Very private, quiet and comfortable. A short stay but I would’ve loved to stay longer.
Very nice home. I liked the history of the home and Dr Kay’s involvement in critical local events. The room was nice with a nice bed, microwave and refrigerator.
My sister and I had an amazing time at Dr. Kay’s place.

This small victorian farmhouse was wonderful in every respect. Dr Kay is the consummate hostess and went out of her way to make us feel special even offering to cook a light dinner for us. She is very informed about the past history of Vallejo as well as community activities to save and restore the unique place in history this area possesses. We will not hesitate to tell others about it or to stay here again.
Wonderful stay! Kay is such a sweetheart - we needed to check in late and she welcomed and greeted us in so we felt at home. Very clean and cozy.
Lovely lady who welcomed us into her space. The floors are a bit squeaky but it’s a non-complaint. Perfect for a short stay.
I always enjoying staying at Dr. Kay's place - its comfortable, clean, and convenient to my work. She takes care to meet the needs of her guests.

Such beautiful and peaceful historical house. I was supposed to be finishing up a lot of paperwork that night I stayed but instead i found myself looking up the history of the family that built the house that dates back to the 1850s. I love history and it was such a nice place to relax. I look to stay there again and hopefully will have more time to talk with Dr. Kay who was a very gracious host.

Stay was fine last time. Second time around there was a dog barking all night. Guest next door watching tv loudly through paper thin walls all night. Trash can was filled with a previous guests hair and trash. Host was unclear about disposal of trash. We did not want to throw old soup into her trash bin so we thought it would be nicer to flush it down the toilet as there is no kitchen sink available. Host waited hours after we already departed to insult us and complain. She knows my husband is a general contractor and has experience with plumbing and could have helped. Rather for asking for help all she did was accuse us and insult us. Never again.

Lovely hostess. Felt like a home. Did not have the 'standard' AirBNB towels, fixtures, and electronics. a nice change. She has furnished the room as the room that one lived in for years. Comfortable, calm.
We had a good overnight stay with Dr. Kay. She is very friendly and helpful. The house is cozy and the room is neat, has the necessities you want. I'd recommend!
Nice host in an interesting house with a story.

Great place to stay at. Room was very cozy and interior was well designed. Place was clean and it was very handy to have a microwave, fridge and small utensils. Lot of thought put into making guests comfortable

Dr Kay was a gracious host and responded to all of my needs . She was very helpful accommodating me whilst on a crutch .
Her house is very charming in a quiet beautiful neighborhood. I would highly recommended staying at her air b and b .

Dr. Kay is amazing! I'm so glad we got a chance to connect while I was at her home. It is beautiful, calm, quiet and very well decorated. The room itself and bed were very comfortable and I felt very much at home. I liked it so much that I extended my trip. Thanks Kay and hope to return.
Great stay with a polite host!
Lots of charm, good stay and good value.
We highly recommend this place! Dr. Kay is super friendly and very helpful! We were greeted with champagne :) Beautiful and well-maintained house. We felt at home. I highly recommend it!

She was so lovely and the stay was magical! I might even come back to California just to enjoy the cottage and write! The house had the heartbeat of community, and Dr. Kay's poetry is incredible. Highly recommend.

a super stay over the new year. had a most wonderful experience and learning as well from a productive writer, poet and professor.will definitely come back whenever possible and strongly recommend it to everyone.
We had a good night in a comfortable home with lots of charm
Really warm and home-like place! Will definitely consider a second visit next time

Dr. Kay's place was absolutely wonderful! Very clean and private even while being a room inside a shared home.
I felt like I had my own space and I got to talk to Dr. Kay about the history of the space and her work.
just what I needed :)
very cozy, comfortable space. Dr. Kay was a great hostess!
many thanks

Had a wonderful stay in this enchanted historic home! Impressive at how well kept it is for a home built in the 1850’s, and still has the nostalgia of another place and time with period correct furnishings and decor, and I love the original artwork. Dr Kay was friendly and made us feel special with a warm welcome! I appreciate the quiet vicinity of the home as well as the neighborhood filled with other charming historic homes. This was my first experience renting a room within a home, but there was plenty of privacy. It was very clean and charming at every turn. I felt like I was in a classic romance novel or film! It’s the best deal for such a special place and I highly recommend it!

Dr Kay was absolutely wonderful. She is kind and welcoming. Her story filled life is a treasure should you be lucky enough to hear about! It is very homey and you will feel as though you have an extra family member. The bed is very firm is the only downside unless you like firm beds.
She was very engaging and helpful
I have come here several times now for my work and love it each time. Dr. Kay has created a very welcoming and comfortable environment which makes me feel right at home.

Dr. Kay's place is a rare gem of a great host, wonderful location and a comfortable place to stay. I enjoy visiting the Napa area but too many places are pricing themselves into the stratosphere. I am really glad I found Kay's place!
Kay was very responsive and caring. She communicated frequently prior to and during the trip; she ensured I had everything I needed for a great stay.
Everything I needed was in the room and bathroom. The room itself was very comfortable with a lovely bed. I tend to be cold at night and she had a space heater in the room which was a nice touch to boost the temperature.
There is also a fridge and microwave in the room (along with utensils), water, coffee, etc.
Kay greeted me when I arrived and gave me a tour. It was nice to meet her and she even offered to chat one night if I was free. I was glad I did - she has a wealth of knowledge of the area and was a great conversationalist.
I look forward to staying at Kay's place again. Highly recommended!
Dr. Kay was a great host, she welcomed me at the door and introduced me to the house. Convenient location . Cozy and clean!

Very happy with my stay. Dr. Kay is a charming and very caring woman and above all a literary enthusiast. I completely disconnected, the place and the house are great, as in the description . The bedding is great, I slept like a baby. The garden has several fruit trees and beautiful plants.
Enjoy your stay, highly recommend it.
Thank you
Dr. Kay was a very friendly host who greeted us on arrival with a little bite and drink. The room itself was very spacious and pleasant, and had everything we expected. Thanks for the nice stay!

Delightful host in a beautiful, historic home. Clean and comfortable. The rental room faces the front of the home, which may be an issue if you are sensitive to light while sleeping. Window air conditioning and free-standing radiators for heat. A small frig, microwave, wine glasses, coffee cups and table utensils are in the room. There is a lovely front porch and a gorgeous back porch and garden. Kitchen access can be arranged. Vallejo is an interesting town with several good restaurants and a lovely downtown with a variety of shops. It is an easy drive to the Napa Valley.
I was there under very difficult circumstances. Dr. Kay was kind and supportive, which helped me immensely. She is a thoughtful person with broad interests, making her a great conversationalist.
Dr. Kay was a great host, she welcomed us at the door and introduced us to the house. Convenient location to restaurants and shops, as well as a day trip to Napa etc. Cozy and clean!
Dr. Kay's place is comfortable and clean, and is 20-25 minutes drive from the wine trail

Very hospitable host. She gave me an idea of the historical significance of the residence, and provided me a written description of it along with the house rules. I enjoyed perusing the books and the tea. It truly was a nice, quiet peaceful experience which is what I hoped for during my brief stay.
A lovely host and I felt at home from the moment I was greeted.

Dr Kay was amazing she looked after us really well and the house was beautiful including the kitchen and garden wish we had stayed longer
Rekha and Pratul
I have stayed here several times now for work and am extremely satisfied each time. The room is perfect for me, the bed is comfortable, and I feel right at home.
This place is amazing! and dr. Kay is a wonderful host! Couldn't recommend more!

Charming house and comfy room!
It was such a welcome break from a couple of days camping.
Kay is a very friendly person and I can totally recommend her place.
Dr Kay is so nice and welcoming. We stayed for one night and had a good time. Comfortable place, good neighborhood, clean house and bathroom. Would stay there again.
It was an absolutely delightful stay. Dr Kay was a great host and her vintage house was artistic and gorgeous. The neighborhood was open, pretty and peaceful. Street parking was easy. Five stars.
Dr. Kay was very nice and friendly.

The room has everything you need for a simple and pleasant stay, including a comfy bed, a desk, and silverware/bowls/plates/microwave/mini fridge to enjoy your own food. No TV is in the room, but having a phone will suffice, especially since the power outlet is located conveniently next to the bed. The bathroom is nearby and always clean. The shower can be confusing to operate between its two knobs, so just a heads up that the left knob is basically off/on and the right knob is hot/cold. Because it is an older home with wooden floors, it is best to carry luggage instead of drag it, but just note you do have to walk up a thin flight of stairs to get to your room. Lastly, it would be nice if full access was granted to the kitchen, but I give props to Dr. Kay to being upfront about kitchen usage being on a case-by-case basis with advanced approval in her description. However, I personally have not used the kitchen during any of my visits.
